page.title: 02Aboyne Primary School
page.content: Aboyne Primary School has 230 pupils and 9 teachers backed by Visiting Specialist Teachers. Most children are resident in the village, some travel by school bus. In the five hour day children are involved in a variety of skills and interests with principal concern for reading and number skills and awareness. Oil related settlement since 1975 has increased the school population fron 170 to 230 (there was a peak of 270 in 1979) and in that period the native North East Scot representation changed from two-thirds to one-third. From school, extra-mural and village activities the children, if they chose to, may glean a full, educational and rewarding life in a safe and pleasant environment.
